00008 const char* modules::reader::fGlobalModule="global";

00010 static std::string getOneWord(const std::string& in, size_t start=0, size_t stop=std::string::npos){
00011         //int begin=in.find_first_not_of(' ',start);
00012         //int end=in.find_last_not_of(' ',stop);
00013         //int begin=start, end=stop;
00014         //std::cout<<"trim: "<<in<<'\t'<<in[begin]<<'\t'<<in[end]<<std::endl;
00015         std::stringstream ss(in.substr(start,stop));
00016         std::string word;
00017         ss>>word;
00018         return word;
00019 }
00020 
00021 static void getSeveralWords(const std::string& in, std::vector<std::string> &vect, size_t start=0, size_t stop=std::string::npos){
00022         //int begin=in.find_first_not_of(' ',start);
00023         //int end=in.find_last_not_of(' ',stop);
00024         //int begin=start, end=stop;
00025         //std::cout<<"trim: "<<in<<'\t'<<in[begin]<<'\t'<<in[end]<<std::endl;
00026         char line[400];
00027         strcpy(line,in.substr(start,stop-start).c_str());
00028         char* word = strtok(line,", ");
00029         while(word != NULL){ 
00030             vect.push_back(word);
00031             word = strtok(NULL,", ");
00032         }
00033 }

00035 int modules::reader::ReadFile(const char* name){
00036 
00037     // Open config file
00038     std::ifstream infile;
00039     int ret = OpenFile(name,infile);
00040     if(ret!=0) return ret;
00041 
00042     // make sure we have a default section set up
00043     AddSection(fGlobalModule);
00044 
00045     // Loop over each line
00046     std::string full_line;
00047     std::string section=fGlobalModule, new_section;
00048     Option_t current_opt;
00049     fLineNumber=0;
00050     while(std::getline(infile,full_line)){
00051         fLineNumber++;
00052 
00053         // tokenize the line straight away
00054         std::stringstream line(full_line);
00055 
00056         // check if this line is a comment
00057         if(isComment(line) ) continue;
00058 
00059         // If this line contains a section name make sure we begin a new section
00060         new_section=findSectionName(line);
00061         if(new_section!="") {
00062             section=new_section;
00063             if(fShouldPrint) std::cout<<"Found new section: "<<section<<std::endl;
00064             if(section!="MODULES") {
00065                 AddSection(section);
00066             }
00067             continue;
00068         }
00069 
00070         if(section=="MODULES") {
00071           //  In the MODULES secton each line specifies a module to use
00072             ret=AddModule(full_line);
00073             if(ret!=0) return ret;
00074         }else{
00075             // Parse the contents of this option
00076             current_opt=SplitOption(full_line);
00077 
00078             // Handle the option as required
00079             if(section==fGlobalModule) {
00080                 ProcessGlobalOption(current_opt);
00081             } else{
00082                 AddOption(section,current_opt);
00083             }
00084             if(fShouldPrint) std::cout<<"Found option: "<<full_line<<std::endl;
00085         }
00086     }
00087     return 0;
00088 }

00090 int modules::reader::OpenFile(const char* name, std::ifstream& infile){
00091     infile.close();
00092     infile.open(name, std::ifstream::in);
00093     if(!infile.is_open()) {
00094         std::cout<<"Problem opening modules file: "<<name<<std::endl;
00095         return 1;
00096     }
00097     if(fShouldPrint) std::cout<<"Found modules file: "<<name<<std::endl;
00098     return 0;
00099 }

00101 bool modules::reader::isComment( std::stringstream& line){
00102     char word='\0';
00103     line>>word;
00104     if(word=='#' || word =='\0'){
00105         return true;
00106     } 
00107     line.clear();
00108     line.seekg(0,std::stringstream::beg);
00109     //line<<word;
00110     return false;
00111 }
00112 
00113 std::string modules::reader::findSectionName(std::stringstream& line){
00114     // sections are marked with [] either side of the name
00115     static std::string word;
00116     word="";
00117     char start=0,stop=0;
00118     line>>start>>word>>stop;
00119     //std::cout<<line.good()<<std::endl;
00120     //std::cout<<line.str()<<'\t'<< start <<'\t'<< word<<'\t'<<stop<<std::endl;
00121     if(start=='['){
00122         if( stop != ']') {// occurs if no whitespace between closing brace and word
00123             stop = word[word.size()-1];
00124             if(stop == ']') word.resize(word.size()-1);
00125         }
00126         if(stop == ']') return word;
00127     }
00128     return "";
00129 }

00131 int modules::reader::AddModule(std::string line){
00132     std::string name, type;
00133 
00134     // How is this module specified ? 
00135     // If  the line contains an equals sign, assume we have a name and a type
00136     // (and possibly arguments), if not, assume it's just a type (and possibly
00137     // arguments)
00138     size_t equ_pos=line.find('=');
00139     if(equ_pos==std::string::npos) {
00140         // module is not named
00141         name="";
00142     }else{
00143         // module is named
00144         name=getOneWord(line,0,equ_pos);
00145         line=line.substr(equ_pos+1);
00146     }
00147 
00148     // Get the type of the module to be used
00149     size_t br_pos=line.find('(');
00150     type=getOneWord(line,0,br_pos);
00151 
00152     // Get arguments to the module if they're provided
00153     std::vector<std::string> args;
00154     if(br_pos!=std::string::npos) {
00155         size_t br_close_pos=line.rfind(')');
00156         if(br_close_pos ==std::string::npos) {
00157             std::cout<<"Error on line "<<fLineNumber<<": no closing parenthesis for arguments of '"<<type<<"'"<<std::endl;
00158             return 2;
00159         } else {
00160             getSeveralWords(line,args,br_pos+1, br_close_pos);
00161         }
00162     }
00163 
00164     if(fShouldPrint){
00165         std::cout<<"Adding module: '"<<type<<"'"<<std::endl;
00166         std::cout<<"   with name: '"<<name<<"'"<<std::endl;
00167         std::cout<<"   and "<<args.size()<<" arguments:"<<std::endl;
00168         for(unsigned i=0;i<args.size() ;i++)
00169                 std::cout<<"     "<<i<<'\t'<<args[i]<<std::endl;
00170     }
00171 
00172     //Add the module to the list of modules
00173     modules::options* opts;
00174     if(name==""){
00175         opts=new modules::options(type);
00176     }else{
00177         // since the module has been named, create a section to store other
00178         // options that may be provided subsequently
00179         if(!AddSection(name,type)){
00180             std::cout<<"Error on line "<<fLineNumber<<": module name is being reused"<<std::endl;
00181             return 1;
00182         }
00183         opts=fAllOptions[name];
00184     }
00185     // Add all arguments passed to this module to it's options
00186     for(unsigned i=0;i<args.size();i++) {
00187         opts->AddArgument(i,args[i]);
00188     }
00189 
00190     // Stick this module into the list of modules
00191     fModules.push_back(std::make_pair(type,opts));
00192 
00193     // Apply current global options to new module
00194     if(fDebugAll) AddOption(opts,"debug");
00195 
00196     return 0;
00197 }
00198 
00199 modules::reader::Option_t modules::reader::SplitOption( const std::string& line){
00200     Option_t opt;
00201     opt.value="";
00202     opt.mode=kSet;
00203 
00204     //split the line around any equals sign
00205     size_t equ_pos=line.find('=');
00206     if(equ_pos==std::string::npos) {
00207       // no equal sign, treat option as bool flag
00208         opt.key=line;
00209     }else if(line[equ_pos-1]=='+'){
00210       // option should be appended to an existing one
00211         opt.key=line.substr(0,equ_pos-1);
00212         opt.value=line.substr(equ_pos+1);
00213         opt.mode=kAppend;
00214     }else{
00215       // option is simple key value pair
00216         opt.key=line.substr(0,equ_pos);
00217         opt.value=line.substr(equ_pos+1);
00218     }
00219     return opt;
00220 }
00221 
00222 void modules::reader::AddOption(modules::options* options, const Option_t& opt){
00223     bool exists;
00224     switch (opt.mode){
00225         case kSet:
00226             options->SetOption(opt.key,opt.value);
00227             break;
00228         case kAppend:
00229             exists= options->AppendToOption(opt.key,opt.value);
00230             if(!exists &&fShouldPrint){
00231                     std::cout<<"Cannot append to '"<<opt.key<<"' as it doesn't already exist"<<std::endl;
00232             }
00233             break;
00234         default: 
00235             std::cout<<"modules::reader::AddOption(): That's odd!  How did I end up here?"<<std::endl;
00236             break;
00237     }
00238 }
00239 
00240 void modules::reader::AddOption(modules::options* options, const std::string& flag){
00241     options->SetOption(flag,"");
00242 }

00244 void modules::reader::PrintAllOptions()const{
00245     // Global options that were set
00246     SectionsList::const_iterator it_sec=fAllOptions.find(fGlobalModule);
00247     if(it_sec!=fAllOptions.end() && it_sec->second->GetNumOptions()>0){
00248        std::cout<<"__ Global otions __"<<std::endl;
00249        it_sec->second->DumpOptions();
00250        std::cout<<std::endl;
00251     }
00252 
00253     // Modules that were requested
00254     std::cout<<"__ All modules __"<<std::endl;
00255     ModuleList::const_iterator it_mod;
00256     for(it_mod=fModules.begin(); it_mod != fModules.end();it_mod++){
00257         std::cout<<"Module: "<<it_mod->first<<std::endl;
00258         it_mod->second->DumpOptions();
00259         std::cout<<std::endl;
00260     }
00261     
00262     // Sections that were added, but don't correspond to a module
00263     std::cout<<"__ Unused sections __"<<std::endl;
00264     for(it_sec=fAllOptions.begin(); it_sec != fAllOptions.end();it_sec++){
00265         if(it_sec->first==fGlobalModule) continue;
00266         for(it_mod=fModules.begin(); it_mod != fModules.end();it_mod++){
00267             if(it_sec->second==it_mod->second ) break;
00268         }
00269         if(it_mod!=fModules.end()) continue;
00270         std::cout<<"Section: "<<it_sec->first<<std::endl;
00271         it_sec->second->DumpOptions();
00272         std::cout<<std::endl;
00273     }
00274 }

00276 void modules::reader::SetDebug(){
00277     std::cout<<"Debug mode activated"<<std::endl;
00278     fShouldPrint=true;
00279     modules::factory::Instance()->SetDebug();
00280 }
00281 
00282 void modules::reader::SetDebugAll(){
00283     SetDebug();
00284     fDebugAll=true;
00285     AddOptionAll("debug");
00286 }
00287 
00288 void modules::reader::AddOptionAll(const std::string& key,const std::string& value){
00289     for(SectionsList::iterator it_sec=fAllOptions.begin(); it_sec != fAllOptions.end();it_sec++){
00290        if(it_sec->first==fGlobalModule) continue;
00291        it_sec->second->SetOption(key,value);
00292     }
00293 }
00294 
00295 void modules::reader::ProcessGlobalOption(Option_t opt){
00296   if (opt.mode==kAppend) {
00297      if(fShouldPrint) std::cout<<"Warning: over-writing '"<<opt.key<<"' with '"
00298                      << opt.value<<"' despite append operator being used"<<std::endl;
00299   }
00300   if (opt.key=="debug"){
00301      if (opt.value=="all"){
00302         SetDebugAll();
00303      } else{
00304         SetDebug();
00305      }
00306   }else {
00307      if(fShouldPrint) std::cout<<"Warning: Unknown global option given, '"<<opt.key<<"'"<<std::endl;
00308      return;
00309   }
00310 }
